intro: Lysionotus coccinus, commonly known as the red-flowered pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its flowers are usually short-lived, opening in the morning and closing by midday. Lysionotus coccinus is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and unique appearance.
